title: U.S. braces for more attacks as Afghan evacuations continue
itunes:title: U.S. braces for more attacks as Afghan evacuations continue
description:
Reuters reports that U.S. troops at Kabul's airport are bracing for more possible Islamic State attacks as they work to evacuate Americans and Afghan allies, following yesterday’s deadly strikes.

The water crisis in Flint, Michigan, disproportionately affected people of color. Mother Jones explores how the majority-Black city’s response to COVID closed the racial gap.

Next month, mortgage giant Fannie Mae will start considering rent-payment history as part of mortgage approvals. USA Today breaks down how this could help more Americans buy homes.

Giant Burmese pythons are killing wildlife in the Florida Everglades. A Field & Stream reporter went along with the snake hunters doing the dangerous work of removing them.
content:encoded:
Reuters reports that U.S. troops at Kabul's airport are bracing for more possible Islamic State attacks as they work to evacuate Americans and Afghan allies, following yesterday’s deadly strikes.

The water crisis in Flint, Michigan, disproportionately affected people of color. Mother Jones explores how the majority-Black city’s response to COVID closed the racial gap.

Next month, mortgage giant Fannie Mae will start considering rent-payment history as part of mortgage approvals. USA Today breaks down how this could help more Americans buy homes.

Giant Burmese pythons are killing wildlife in the Florida Everglades. A Field & Stream reporter went along with the snake hunters doing the dangerous work of removing them.
